messages.page_content:
- Topic: Establishment of Crisis Intervention Strategy Task Force
- Summary: Motion establishing an advisory committee to provide recommendations concerning the implementation of a crisis response program for Orleans Parish. The advisory task force, known as the Crisis Intervention Strategy Task Force, will consist of 13 members appointed by various entities, including the Mayor and the City Council.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-203
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to establish the Crisis Intervention Strategy Task Force was passed with 7 YEAS and no NAYS.

The recommendation of the City Planning Commission was "FOR APPROVAL", subject to eleven (11) provisos. The request was approved and granted the Conditional Use, subject to the 11 provisos contained in the City Planning report.

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of City's Towing Allocation List
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to amend and reordain the entirety of Article XII, of Chapter 162, of the Code of the City of New Orleans, regarding the City's towing allocation list. It intended to remove the use of tow zones in the City's tow allocation program, establish revised procedures, fees, penalties, and other requirements. The ordinance was electronically submitted and was continued to the meeting of 7/1/21.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,303
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: N/A - (Continued to the meeting of 7/1/21)
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the meeting of 7/1/21
- UID: 881093fd-b1f6-40b4-b859-4457f9153197

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with Jefferson Parish Sheriffs Office
- Summary: This ordinance authorized the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement between the City of New Orleans and Jefferson Parish Sheriffs Office for the public purpose of participating in a Criminal Intelligence Center operated by JPSO in Jefferson Parish. The Criminal Justice Committee recommended approval, and the ordinance was adopted with 7 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,327
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Adopt - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Approved
- UID: 881093fd-b1f6-40b4-b859-4457f9153197

- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to amend the operating budget of the City of New Orleans for the year 2021 by appropriating federal grant funds from Intergovernmental Transfers to the Mayor’s Office of Homeland Security for FEMA reimbursement related costs.

- Votes Summary:

The ordinance sets forth the minimum price and terms of the servitude agreement and declares that such use will not interfere with the public right-of-way.

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Lease with New Cingular Wireless PCS, LLC for Rooftop Space
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to execute a lease with New Cingular Wireless PCS, LLC for a portion of the rooftop space at 1601 Perdido Street for a period of five years, with optional renewal terms. The yearly rental starts at $30,000.00 with a 15% increase for each renewal term.
- Ordinance Number: 33339 - 28707 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with 6 YEAS and 1 member absent.
- UID: 7e5bc877-f97a-4cef-b699-75821ba0dadc

- Topic: Lease with the United States Postal Service
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to execute a lease with the United States Postal Service for portions of South Liberty Street and Julia Street for a period from October 1, 2020, to September 30, 2025. The yearly rental starts at $259,022.00 with a flat increase to a total rent of $293,060.00 per year for one five-year option term.
- Ordinance Number: 33340 - 28708 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with 6 YEAS and 1 member absent.
- UID: 7e5bc877-f97a-4cef-b699-75821ba0dadc

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment No. 2 to Cooperative Endeavor Agreement (CEA) with Audubon Commission
- Summary: The ordinance aims to authorize the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into Amendment No. 2 to a previously executed Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with the Audubon Commission to support the economic growth of the city through the creation of public park spaces and redevelopment of the Governor Nicholls and Esplanade Avenue Wharves. The amendment proposes to extend the deadlines by four calendar years from the original date set forth in the CEA and three years from the date provided in Amendment No. 1. The matter was deferred until July 1, 2021.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,347
- Votes Summary:
  - Motion: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The matter was deferred until July 1, 2021.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, Amendment, Economic Growth, Public Park Spaces, Redevelopment, Extension
- UID: f373d78f-2b1a-49ad-b006-5632c3d3e788

- Topic: Resolution Ordering and Calling an Election for Ad Valorem Tax Levy
- Summary: The ordinance announces the intention to consider adopting a resolution ordering and calling an election to authorize the levy of an ad valorem tax in the City of New Orleans. The resolution is planned to be considered at the meeting on July 15, 2021.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-211
- Votes Summary:
  - Motion: Adopted - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The resolution was adopted, and the matter was continued to the meeting on July 15, 2021.
- Tags/Keywords: Resolution, Election, Ad Valorem Tax, Levy
- UID: f373d78f-2b1a-49ad-b006-5632c3d3e788

- Summary: This ordinance authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into an agreement to grant a servitude to an adjacent property owner for encroachments on/over portions of public right-of-way located at the municipal address 501 Decatur Street. The ordinance was electronically submitted and was postponed on 10/15/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33366
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Postponement on 10/15/21

- Topic: Lease Agreement at Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport
- Summary: The ordinance approves and authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Lease Agreement at Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport with SMI TRANSPORT, LLC.

- Topic: Amendment of Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance
- Summary: The ordinance amends various articles of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance of the City of New Orleans to create a definition and use standards for "shooting range" and make other necessary amendments.
- Ordinance Number: 33368
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 1 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)

- Topic: Classification of "Dormitory" as a Permitted Use
- Summary: The ordinance classifies "dormitory" as a permitted use in the CBD-1 Core Central Business District.
- Ordinance Number: 33369
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)

- Tags/Keywords: Dormitory, Zoning Ordinance, CBD-1 District
- UID: a0a3faba-a6b1-425d-a108-3cc662c67de8

- Topic: Amendment to Permit Extension of Wireless Telecommunications Tower
- Summary: The ordinance grants an amendment to permit the extension of a wireless telecommunications tower in specified districts.
- Ordinance Number: 33370
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with 5 in favor, 2 against, 1 abstain, and 1 absent.
- Tags/Keywords: Wireless Telecommunications Tower, Zoning Amendment
- UID: a0a3faba-a6b1-425d-a108-3cc662c67de8
